title: Aztec Ruins National Monument: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes       Aztec Ruins Entrance Fees Adults (16 and over): $5.00 per person (good for seven days) Children (under 16): Free Entrance fees are paid at the visitor center.   Fee Free Days All national parks and monuments, including Aztec Ruins, waive entrance fees for certain special occasions each year. See this year's fee free days.      Interagency Passes Interagency passes are honored and can be purchased at the Aztec Ruins visitor center. Passes cover the entrance fees of the passholder and up to three other adults at all national parks and monuments as well as many other federal sites.         Annual Pass  $80, good for 12 months Can be purchased by anyone Non-transferable  Frequently asked questions about the Interagency Annual Pass         Annual Pass for Military  Free, good for 12 months For active-duty military personnel with proper identification (CAC card or DD form 1173)  Frequently asked questions about the Interagency Annual Pass for Military         Senior Pass  $10 lifetime For U.S. citizens of permanent residents age 62 or older with proper identification May provide a 50% discount on other amenities, such as camping  Frequently asked questions about the Interagency Senior Pass         Access Pass  Free for lifetime For U.S. citizens or permanent residents with permanent disabilities May offer a 50% discount on other amenities, such as camping          Volunteer Pass  Free for 12 months For people who have completed 250 service hours with federal agencies that participate in the Interagency Pass Program Check out Aztec Ruins' volunteer opportunities or see positions nationwide on Volunteer.gov
